			Barcelona
		

		Kylian Mbappe breaks silence over £259m Al-Hilal transfer after NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo’s cheeky tweet

				
							
					
											

					
						
							By
Dave Dekker
						

						
							Published
 July 25, 2023
							
						

					

				

						
																
		
 			
 			
 				
 			

 			
 			
 			
 				
 			

 			
 			
 			
 				
 			

 			
 			
 			
 				
 			

 			
 			 				 					
 					
 						
 					

 					
 				 			 		
	

 												

		

	

				

			

		

	


										
						
												
							
								
									
																				
	
		 





KYLIAN MBAPPE has broken his silence over Al-Hilal’s world record £259million bid.

Paris Saint-Germain have accepted the Saudi Pro League side’s offer, which would blow the record £198m paid for Neymar out of the water.


5


Kylian Mbappe is the subject of a world-record bid from Al-HilalCredit: Rex


5


Giannis Antetokounmpo joked that Al-Hilal should sign him insteadCredit: Getty

Spanish outlet Relevo claim that Mbappe is “reluctant” to move to Saudi Arabia – despite reportedly being offered up to £11.6m a week to join Al-Hilal.
Advertisement. Scroll to continue reading.




Following news of the Saudi side’s offer, NBA superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo joked that they should sign him instead.

Posting a smiling selfie to social media, the two-time MVP wrote: “Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe.”

The PSG forward saw the funny side, responding to the Milwaukee Bucks star’s tweet with 13 laughing emojis.





























Mbappe was put up for sale by PSG chiefs after making it clear that he will not sign a new contract.

The forward’s deal has reached its final 12 months, with club bosses convinced that he has already agreed to join Real Madrid in 2024.

Should Mbappe opt to join Al-Hilal, PSG would stand to make a nearly £100m profit on the £162m they paid for him in 2018.

Mbappe returned to PSG for pre-season training earlier this month, but was left out of Luis Enrique’s travelling party for the pre-season tour of Japan and Korea.
Advertisement. Scroll to continue reading.






5


Giannis’ tweet seemed to amuse Mbappe
The Ligue 1 champions are determined not to lose their star man on a free transfer, with club president Nasser Al-Khelaifi encouraging Mbappe to seriously consider offers this summer.

It’s claimed that the French icon would be willing to sit out of the entire season in order to leave Parc des Princes on his terms.

PSG believe that Mbappe wants to see out his current deal in France in order to bag a huge bonus – before picking up a staggering £150m signing on fee with Real Madrid.

His refusal to sign a new deal and supposed willingness to sit out of the season is viewed as a “betrayal” of PSG and their supporters.

In addition to Real Madrid, Mbappe has also been linked with Manchester United, Chelsea, Inter Milan and Tottenham.
Advertisement. Scroll to continue reading.




Although reports claim that he is “completely uninterested” in joining the latter.

French paper L’Equipe claim that Barcelona are keen on Mbappe – but cannot afford to pay a transfer fee.


5





They add that Xavi’s side could look to offer players in part-exchange for the forward.

Should Mbappe move to the Saudi Pro League, he would join the likes of Kalidou Koulibaly, Ruben Neves and Sergej Milinkovic-Savic at Al-Hilal – who are also chasing Aleksandar Mitrovic.

Antetokounmpo isn’t the only NBA player to have commented on the money being offered for Mbappe.
Advertisement. Scroll to continue reading.




LeBron James, who will earn around £41.5m next season, posted a gif of Forrest Gump running, captioned: “Me headed to Saudi when they call @RichPaul4 & @mavcarter for that 1 year deal!”





























While wantaway Portland Trailblazers star Damian Lillard wrote: “1 year 776mm? Wtf lol ...”

Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green, who recently penned a four-year £78m deal, added: “They got basketball leagues too right?  I don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet.”


5


LeBron James noticed the huge money offered to Mbappe

<p><strong>KYLIAN MBAPPE has broken his silence over Al-Hilal’s world record £259million bid.</strong>
</p>

</p>
<p>Spanish outlet <a aria-label="Relevo (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" href="https://www.relevo.com/futbol/mercado-fichajes/mbappe-dudas-blanco-arabia-20230724190219-nt.html" target="_blank">Relevo</a> claim that Mbappe is “reluctant” to move to Saudi Arabia – despite reportedly being offered up to £11.6m a week to join Al-Hilal.</p>
<div class="zox-post-ad-wrap"><span class="zox-ad-label">Advertisement. Scroll to continue reading.</span><div class="zox-post-ad"><div class="zox-post-ad-in1"><div class="zox-post-ad-in2"><a href="https://www.ovaboo.com/professional-fascial-massage-gun-sport-relaxation-fitness-ems-muscle-stimulator-handheld-massager/" target="_blank"><img decoding="async" class="zox-post-ad-img lazy" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201%201'%3E%3C/svg%3E" data-src="https://www.footballreporting.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/BgAd.png"></a></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<p>Following news of the Saudi side’s offer, NBA superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo joked that they should sign him instead.
</p>
<p>Posting a smiling selfie to social media, the two-time MVP wrote: “Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe.”
</p>
<p>The PSG forward saw the funny side, responding to the Milwaukee Bucks star’s tweet with 13 laughing emojis.
</p>

</div>

<p>Mbappe was put up for sale by PSG chiefs after making it clear that he will not sign a new contract.
</p>
<p>The forward’s deal has reached its final 12 months, with club bosses convinced that he has already agreed to join Real Madrid in 2024.
</p>
<p>Should Mbappe opt to join Al-Hilal, PSG would stand to make a nearly £100m profit on the £162m they paid for him in 2018.
</p>
<p>Mbappe returned to PSG for pre-season training earlier this month, but was left out of Luis Enrique’s travelling party for the pre-season tour of Japan and Korea.</p>

<figcaption class="article__media-caption"><span class="article__media-span">Giannis’ tweet seemed to amuse Mbappe</span></figcaption></figure>
<p>The Ligue 1 champions are determined not to lose their star man on a free transfer, with club president Nasser Al-Khelaifi encouraging Mbappe to seriously consider offers this summer.
</p>
<p>It’s claimed that the French icon would be willing to sit out of the entire season in order to leave Parc des Princes on his terms.
</p>
<p>PSG believe that Mbappe wants to see out his current deal in France in order to bag a huge bonus – before picking up a staggering £150m signing on fee with Real Madrid.
</p>
<p>His refusal to sign a new deal and supposed willingness to sit out of the season is viewed as a “betrayal” of PSG and their supporters.
</p>
<p>In addition to Real Madrid, Mbappe has also been linked with Manchester United, Chelsea, Inter Milan and Tottenham.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<p>Although reports claim that he is “completely uninterested” in joining the latter.
</p>
<p>French paper L’Equipe claim that Barcelona are keen on Mbappe – but cannot afford to pay a transfer fee.

<p><span class="article__gallery-count-value">5</span>
</p>
</div>

</figure>
</p>
<p>They add that Xavi’s side could look to offer players in part-exchange for the forward.
</p>
<p>Should Mbappe move to the Saudi Pro League, he would join the likes of Kalidou Koulibaly, Ruben Neves and Sergej Milinkovic-Savic at Al-Hilal – who are also chasing Aleksandar Mitrovic.
</p>
<p>Antetokounmpo isn’t the only NBA player to have commented on the money being offered for Mbappe.</p>
<div class="zox-post-ad-wrap"><span class="zox-ad-label">Advertisement. Scroll to continue reading.</span><div class="zox-post-ad"><div class="zox-post-ad-in1"><div class="zox-post-ad-in2"><a href="https://www.ovaboo.com/professional-fascial-massage-gun-sport-relaxation-fitness-ems-muscle-stimulator-handheld-massager/" target="_blank"><img decoding="async" class="zox-post-ad-img lazy" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201%201'%3E%3C/svg%3E" data-src="https://www.footballreporting.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/BgAd.png"></a></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<p>LeBron James, who will earn around £41.5m next season, posted a gif of Forrest Gump running, captioned: “Me headed to Saudi when they call @RichPaul4 & @mavcarter for that 1 year deal!”
</p>
